Area of a Triangle

    Area of a triangle = \({1\over 2}\times base\times altitude\)

  1. Let \(P(x_1 , y_1)\), \(Q(x_2 , y_2)\) and \(R(x_3 , y_3)\), three non-collinear points are vertices of a triangle \(\Delta PQR\)

    2. Then, Area of the triangle is given by the numerical value of following expression:

    Area of \(\Delta PQR\) = \({1\over 2}[x_1(y_2-y_3)+x_2(y_3-y_1)+x_3(y_1-y_2)]\)
